'''Foongus''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''タマゲタケ''' ''Tamagetake'') is a dual-type {{2t|Grass|Poison}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Amoonguss}} starting at [[level]] 39.

==Biology==
Foongus is a white mushroom-like Pokémon with a cap that looks quite similar to a [[Poké Ball]]. It has stubby, digit-less arms, a large pink mouth, and pinprick-like dark eyes. It uses the Poké Ball-like pattern on its head to lure people and Pokémon in grassy areas, then releases a cloud of poisonous spores to defend itself. It moves by either hopping or turning on its side and rolling on its cap.

==In the anime==
[[File:Foongus anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Foongus in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Foongus debuted in ''[[BW032|Facing Fear with Eyes Wide Open!]]'', when a group of Foongus {{status|poisoned}} {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}}'s Pokémon after {{AP|Scraggy}} used {{m|Headbutt}} on the Mushroom Pokémon.

A Foongus appeared in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]''. A girl named [[Marigold]] played with it, then hid it from [[Mr. Hatterly|her father]] as she was afraid he would not like it.

A Foongus appeared in ''[[BW087|Expedition to Onix Island!]]'', where it ended up attacking {{an|Dawn}} when she got too close.

Multiple Foongus appeared in ''[[BW138|Go, Go Gogoat!]]'', where they attacked Ash and his friends with {{m|Poison Powder}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Foongus briefly appeared ''[[BW056|The Lonely Deino!]]'', under the care of [[Bobby]]. It was being picked up by its {{pkmn|Trainer}}, who referred to it as his "Best Buddy".

Foongus made cameo appearances in ''[[BW051|Lost at the Stamp Rally!]]'', ''[[BW053|A Maractus Musical!]]'', ''[[BW057|The Mighty Accelguard to the Rescue!]]'', ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]'', ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]'', and ''[[BW071|Search for the Clubultimate!]]''.

Multiple Foongus appeared in ''[[BW085|All for the Love of Meloetta!]]''.

A Foongus appeared in ''[[BW107|Cameron's Secret Weapon!]]''.

A Foongus appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]''.

Multiple Foongus appeared in ''[[BW136|A Pokémon of a Different Color!]].''

Multiple Foongus appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Foongus appeared in ''[[XY057|Thawing an Icy Panic!]]'' and ''[[XY059|Under the Pledging Tree!]]''.

Multiple Foongus appeared in ''[[XY071|So You're Having a Bad Day!]]''. {{an|Bonnie}} and {{MTR}} landed on top of them, and whilst Meowth was able to escape unscathed, Bonnie fell victim to their {{m|Spore}}s.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Foongy}}
A Foongus appeared in ''[[PS479|The Case of the Missing Pokémon]]'', where it was one of the Pokémon kidnapped by Team Plasma. It was later found in a stronghold and returned to its Trainer.

A Foongus appeared in ''[[PS494|Up in the Air]]''.

A Foongus appeared in a flashback in ''[[PS510|A Wretched Reunion]]''.

Foongus is a Pokémon owned by {{adv|Whitley}}. She used him to defeat a {{p|Sigilyph}}, earning his Trainer a Pokédex. This Foongus is nicknamed "Foongy". Foongus was a Pokémon liberated by [[Team Plasma]]. He first appeared in ''[[PS524|A Difficult Parting]]''.

Multiple Foongus appeared in ''[[PAXY28|Scizor Defends]]'' as Pokémon in the [[Pokémon Village]].

==Trivia==
* Foongus, along with its evolution, is similar to {{p|Voltorb}} and {{p|Electrode}} in that it resembles a [[Poké Ball]].
** However, unlike Voltorb and Electrode, it only has a Poké Ball design on it, instead of being in the shape of one.
** Likewise, it features the whole design, complete with the circle resembling the button in the middle (contrary to Voltorb's evolution line having just the shape and general colors, and according to the Pokédex, being transformed Poké Balls themselves).
** Foongus's {{Shiny}} form's coloration is reminiscent of that of the [[Master Ball]]. It shares this trait with {{p|Amoonguss|its evolved form}}.
* Foongus and its {{p|Amoonguss|evolved form}} share their species name with {{p|Paras}}, {{p|Parasect}}, {{p|Shroomish}}, and {{p|Breloom}}. They are all known as the Mushroom Pokémon.
** All six Pokémon also share a common move, {{m|Spore}}, and ability, {{a|Effect Spore}}.
* Foongus is the slowest {{type|Poison}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
It appears to be based on ''{{wp|Amanita muscaria}}'' or mushrooms of the ''{{wp|Agaricus}}'' genus, due to it being {{type|Poison}}. The cap is designed to look like the front of a Poké Ball.

====Name origin====
Foongus is a corruption of ''{{wp|fungus}}'' and may be a combination of ''fool'' (to deceive, referencing its use of its Poké Ball-like cap to attract unsuspecting prey) and ''fungus''. Together with {{p|Amoonguss|its evolution}}, their names are a corruption of the phrase, "Fungus among us."

Tamagetake may be a combination of 玉 ''tama'' (sphere), 魂消る ''tamageru'' (to be astonished), and 茸 ''take'' ({{wp|mushroom}}, or more specifically, the ''{{wp|Shiitake}}'' mushroom).
